str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
A household manager, a steward, guardian.
Various, of different colors, diverse, various. Of uncertain derivation; motley, i.e. Various in character.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From charizomai; a gratuity, i.e. Deliverance;, a endowment, i.e. religious qualification, or miraculous faculty.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From diakonos; to be an attendant, i.e. Wait upon (figuratively) teacher; technically, to act as a Christian deacon.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
